revised_title: A New Theory of Electric and Magnetic Birefringence in Liquids
tldr: The authors propose a new theory of electric and magnetic birefringence in liquids, revising the premises of the Langevin-Born theory. They consider the local polarization field acting on a molecule to be dependent on its orientation with respect to the external field, leading to a modification of the Kerr constant. This new theory explains the deviation of Langevin's theory from observation in the Kerr effect.
